intro: Malachra rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf malachra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive round, fleshy leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Malachra rotundifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
